div.ab:
ــون وفضيل صبا بن هرمز الوئلي وخلد بن ذكون الخزاعي وموسى بن خلد الّيثي الّپى وسعيد ومعبد بن عمران الــيّ
وزهير بن سالم الصّدفي وحفص وحوصپ بن عمران الّيثي الّپى وعطا بن أبي إبرهيم سلم الخولني و
بن الاموى وعپپد پن وعزيز عدر عدـ سلبم الاموى پسهدون ان پرپد ين عبد الله صاحپ
الأمير وحفظه على كورة أخميم وطهطا جمع روس أهل مدينة أخميم ودحاپــ وـ
ــپا وغيرهم فسألهم عن عمرو بن عتّاس عبّاس وكتّابه وعمّاله پپــ
وصحّــحـــوا أن عمــرو بن عبّاس عبّاس وكتّابه وعمّالــه وـ لم يضــربوا يظلموا لهم قليلا قلبا ولا كــثيرا يدا
فكتبــوا ــوا له على أنفسهم كتابا يكون له براه ولعمرو بن عبّاس عبّاس وكتّابه وعمّاله
المسمّين في هذا الطّومار على أنفسهم ومحمّد بن عبد اللّه الصّدفي وكتب في شهر
من سنة ا ومــائة

*** ***ūna *** wa ṣabā faḍīlu fuḍaylu bnu hurmuza ăl wāʾiliyyu wa ḫālidu bnu ḏakwāna ăl ḫuzāʿiyyu wa mūsà bnu ḫālidi *** ăl lBà layṯiyyu wa saʿīdu maʿbadu bnu ʿimrāna ăl *** ***iyyu
*** wa *** zuhayru bnu sālim:ini ăṣ ṣadafiyyu wa ḥafṣu ḥwṣB bnu ʿimrāna ăl layṯiyyu lBà wa ʿaṭāʾu bnu ʾabī ʾibrāhīma sālim:in ăl ḫawlāniyyu wa ø ***
bnu *** *** ăl *** ʾumawiyyu wa ʿdru ʿd* ʿubaydu ʿazīzu bnu salīm:ini ăl ʾumawiyyu yašhadūna ʾanna yazīda bna ʿabdi ăl lāhi ṣāḥiba ***
ăl *** ʾamīri ø wa *** ḥāfiẓu ø hu ø ʿalà *** kūraẗi ʾaḫmīma wa ṭahṭā ǧamaʿa ruʾusa ʾahli madīnaẗi ʾaḫmīma wa dḥʾB** ***
*** ***Bʾ *** wa ġayr hum fa saʾala hum ʿan ʿamri bni ʿabbāsa ʿattāsa wa kuttābi hi wa ʿummāli hi BB*** ***
*** wa *** ṣaḥḥaḥū ʾanna ʿamra bna ʿabbāsa ʿattāsa wa kuttāba hu wa ʿummāla *** hu lam yaḍribū yaẓlimū la hum qalīl:an qalb:an wa lā kaṯīr:an yad:an
fa ø katabū ***ū la hu ʿalà ʾanfusi him kitāb:an yakūna la hu barāʾaẗ:an wa li ʿamri bni ʿabbāsa ʿattāsa wa kuttābi hi wa *** ʿummāli ø hi
ăl *** musammayna ø fī *** hāḏā ăṭ ṭūmāri ʿalà ʾanfusi him wa muḥammadi bni ʿabdi ăl lāhi ăṣ ṣadafiyyi wa kutiba fī *** šahri ***
*** min sanaẗi ʾ wa miʾaẗ:in

[In the na]me of the Father [a]nd of the Son and of the Holy Ghost. (On) the third Choiak, i[ndiction ............
[We write unto] the public authority, na[mely] our l[or]d Jezid, son of Abdella, most glorious [master, illustrius and]
[pagarch of the] town of [Š]m[in] (Aḫmîm). [We all who] are to the north of Psooun and to the south of Psooun, [and we show the]
[persons] and their names at the bottom of the declaration. Seeing that our lord Ab[d......... the son of ......, most eminent
[Govern]or - may God bless him - had sent you southward in the matter of Amira (ʿAmr) that you [
[...] with his scribe, his notaries and all his assistants [
[...... re]funded our dues unto us. Thus your lordship has gathered us [all together ......]
[and we] inform your lordship, that neither Amer (ʿAmr) nor any of his assistants [have oppressed
[...] you have, therefore, asked us for this declaration. Now, then, [we declare, that they]
[did not] oppress any one of us, neither in town, nor in the nome, nor yet outside [the nome. But if it should happen that]
[one] of us should bring a complaint and declare that we had been oppressed in any way, [then we shall be]
[liable to] any fine that we shall fix for us because of this matter. God [is our witness]
[that we] have written this declaration, and we agree thereunto.
[I, Apol]lo, in the Lord bishop, agree.
[I,] Antonios, prior of the monastery of Apa Ouaenin, agree.
[I, C]yria Cyriacos, son of the late Sophronios, inhabitant of Tektetripe, agree.
[I, J]ohn, son of the late Thomas, inhabitant of Tesmine, agree.
[I,] Solomon, son of the late Collouthos, inhabitant of Psikô, agree.
[I,] Noah, son of the late Esido(ros), inhabitant of Tabennese, assent in regard to the validity of this declaration.
[I,] Apa David, archimandrite of the Monastery of Apa Zenobios, agree. I Phoib(ammon), notary, have written for him.
[I,] Apa Severos, prior of Teḥkemou, assent to the validity of this declaration; I, Jacob, have written for [him].
[I,] Phil(o)th(eos), son of Olympios, inhabita[nt o]f [A]pa Collouth(os) of Pešove, assent to the validity of this declaration. I,
[I,] Jôre, son of the late Patermoute, inhabitant of Atripe, agree; I, Papas, have written [for him].
[I,] Victor, son of Zach(arias), inhabitant of Jinjêv, agree.
[I,] Severos, son of the late Ph[o]ib(ammon), inhabitant of Ḥagoore, agree.
[I,] Petros, son of Psate, in[ha]bitant of Patri(cion), agree.
[I,] Collouthos, son of the late Phoib(ammon), inhabitant of Pboou, agree.
[I,] [I]saac, son of the late Constatios, of Pneveit, agree.
[I,] Pesi(re), son of the late Victo[r, i]nhabitant of Salabaou, agree. By God's will Severos Phoi(bammon), inhabitant of Ḥagoore, has writ[ten for me].
[I,] Philoth(eos), son of t[he late M]ark, agree.
[I,] Ouanafre, son of t[he late Ig]natios, inhabitant of Athere, agree.
[I,] Petros, [son of the late Mo]ises, inhabitant of Psibelage, agree.
[I,] Phoibamon, so[n of the late C]omet(os), inhabitant of (the Monastery of) Leontios, agree. I, Apa Cyros, have [written].
[for him (assenting)] to its validi[ty. I, Petr......, inhabitant of] Papar, agree.
[I, Olymp]ios, son of Phoi[b(ammon), inhabitant of the Mona]stery of Athanasios, agree. I, Petros, by God's will deacon, have written for him as he (himself) cannot [do (so)].
[I, E]noch, s[on of Zacharias, a]gree.
[We ......]it, son of (?) ʿAbdell[a (ʿAbdallâh) and .........]p, son of Abdella, inhabitants of Psibelake, agree to this declaration.
[I, G]eorge, son of [the late So]phronios, inhabitant of Tekou, agree. I, Const(an)t(ios), official, have written for him.
[I,] Philotheos, son of Collouthos, inhabitant of Samacher, agree.
[I,] Petros, son of the late I[si]doros, agree. I, Thomas, deacon, inhabitant of Papar, have written for him, as he (himself) cannot d[o (so)].
[I, Theo]doros, son of Metod(o)r(os), inhabitant of Psinbelje, agree.
[I, ......, s]on of Pesynth(e), inhabitant of Ap[a ......]e in the field of Toetô, agree. I, Theodoros, of Psinbelje, have written for [him].
[I, .....].. the humble priest and prior of the town of Šmin, agree.
[I, .........], son of the late Zachar[ias,] assent to the validity of this declaration.
[I, Se]veros, son of the late Isidoros, inhabitant, of the town of Šmin, agree.
[I, ......]chos, son of the late Athanasios, inhabitant of the town of Šmin, agree.
[I, S]erge, son of the late Philotheos, inhabitant of the town of Šmin, agree.
[I, Leo]ntake, son of Apa Cyros, inhabitant of the town of Šmin, agree.
[I, As]clepios, son of the la[te] John, agree.
[I, Serg]e, son of Phoibamon, agree.
[I, ......]ape, son of the late Šenoute, agree.
[I, Chae]l, son of Šenoute, agree.
[I, Sev]eros, son of the late Acollouth(os), agree.
[I,] Šenoute, son of the late Philotheos, inhabitant of the town of Šmin, agree.
[I,] Moises, son of the late Paulikios, of Šmin, agree.
[I,] Pegôš, son of the late Moui, of Šmin, agree.
[I,] Philotheos, son of Severos, agree.
[I,] Pesate, humble deacon, agree.
[I,] Pešate, son of Joseph, agree.
[I, J]acob, son of Papnoute, agree.
[I,] Chael, son of the late Isid(oros), inhabitant of the town of Šmin, agree.
[I, P]etros, by God's will deacon and son of the late Georgios, agree.
[I,] Petros, son of Christo(phoros), humble deacon, agree.
[I,] Anstasios, son of the late S[e]veros, agree.
[I,] Cosma, son of Leontake, agree.
[I,] Isaac, son of the late Thomas, agree.
[I,] Adrianos, son of John, agree. I, Pegôš, son of Moui, have written (it).
[I,] Dioscoros, son of the late Ḥellô, agree.
[I, ...... son of the] late Christophoros, agree.
[I,] Paulos, son of the late Christophoros, agree.
[I,] Cyros, son of the late Diosco(ros), inhabitant of the town of Šmin, agree.
[I, Basi]leios, son of the late Diosco(ros), inhabitant of the town of Šmin, agree.
[I, Ad]riane, son of the late Christo(phoros), inhabitant of the town of Šmin, agree.
[I, ......i]s, son of the late Diosco(ros), inhabitant of the town of Šmin, agree.
[I, Theod]oros, son of Collouth(os), inhabitant of Pheve, agree. I, Zacharias, of Toetô, have written for him.
[I, ......], of Phoibamo(n), inhabitant of Šonte, agree.
[I, Phoi]bamon, son of Ḥelaj, inhabitant of Psintek, agree. I, Abraham, have written for him.
[I, Za]charias, son of Pgôl, of Tekô, agree to this declaration.
[I, Ḥ]ellou, son of Pgôl, of Tsar, agree. I, Zacharias, of Toetô, have written for him.
[I,] Petpageor(gios), son of Šenoute, inhabitant of Maenmoire, agree.
Written by me Jacob, by God's will symbolaiographos of Pan(opolis).
Month of Choiak, third. Declaration for Amer, son of Aetaz (ʿAttās), and (his) assistants, from different persons, townsmen and countrymen, ............................................. [
] [S]everos Isido(ros), Leont(a)k(e) Apa C(yros), Asclep(ios) Johannes, Sergios Phoib(amon), Meg(as) Senouth(ios), Chael Isido(ros), Severos Coll[outhos
] Pek(oš) Moui, Philoth(eos) Severos, vintner, Pes(a)t(e) Severos, deacon, Pes(a)t(e) Jose(ph), vintner, Jaco(b) Pannou(t)i(os), Petros Georg(ios), deacon, [
] Isaac Thom(as), Adriano(s) Jo(annes), Dioscoros Ellôt(es), Chael Senouth(ios), Menou(thios) Christo(phoros) Paul(os) Christo(phoros), Apa C(yros), J(o)an(nes), Basi(lios) Dios[c](oros), [
] skoori(...), Theodo(ros) Collouth(os). Names 3[6?].
Apollo, bishop, [An]tonios, prior, of Ouari(...), Cyriaco(s) Sophronios, Enoch Zach(arias) of Triphiou, Jo(annes) Thomas of Mini (Tesmine)
[Dav]id, archimandrite of (the Monastery of) Zenobios, Severos, prior of Chek(em)ou, Philoth(eos) Olymp(ios) of (the Monastery of) Apa Collouth(os), Sergios, Chore Patermou(te) of Triphiou, [Petros]
Psate of Patric(i)o(n), Collouth(os) Phoib(ammon) of Mech (...), Isaac Const(antios) of Phenebeth, Pes(i)re Vict(or) of Salab(a)ou, Ph[iloth(eos) Mark]
] ...... of Psim[.]ou, Phoib(ammon) Comet(os) of (the Monastery of) Leont(ios), Petr...... of Pepar, Olymp(ios) Phoib(ammon) of ......[
[Georg(ios)] Sophronios of Triphiou, Ph[i]loth(eos) Collouth(os) of Sam(a)ch(er), Petr(os) Isido(ros) of ... Atho(...), .................. of T[riphiou]
[Zach]ari(os) Pcolli(os), Maior Petros, Pemouth(ios) of Samuel, Hôr Phoib(ammon), Psat(e) Phoib(ammon) of the Monastery of Ge(...), Atsar Tab [...] Names 3[...].
[b. ......]ûn and Fuḍail b. Hormuz, the Wâʾilite, and Ḫâlid b. Ḏakwân, the Ḫuzâʿite, and Mûsâ b. Ḫâlid, the Laiṯite, and Saʿîd b. ʿImrân, the ...... [
[... and Zu]hair [ben] Sâlim, the Ṣadifite, and Ḥafṣ b. ʿImrân, the Laiṯite, and ʿAṭâ b. Abû Ibrahîm, the Ḫawlânite, and [
[b. So and So], the Umayyad, and ʿUbaid (?) b. Salîm, the Umayyad, are witnessed, that Yazîd b. ʿAbdallâh, [administrator of the Amîr]
[(Governor) and] his overseer over the district of Aḫmîm and Ṭahṭâ, has gathered the headmen of the people of the town of Aḫmîm and ............ [
] ... and others. Then he inquired of them about ʿAmr b. [ʿAttâ]s, and his secretaries and his assistants ......[
[and] they [declared it to be] right that ʿAmr b. ʿAttâs and his secretaries and [assistants] had not prescribed to them either little or m[uch].
They therefore drafted for him a document binding them under an obligation, which might discharge [him], as also ʿAmr b. ʿAttâs, his secretaries [and assistants],
[named in th]is document, binding them under an obligation, and Muḥammad b. ʿAbdallâh, the Ṣadifite, wrote [(it) in the month of]
[......... of the year one h]un[dred and
